item.title: Bill Gates Predicts 'What's At Stake' With Proposed Trump Foreign Aid Cuts
item.description: September 13, 2017 - The Gates Foundation has released projections showing the impact on new cases of HIV and issues like child mortality if there's a global drop in foreign aid.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 13, 2017 - The Gates Foundation has released projections showing the impact on new cases of HIV and issues like child mortality if there's a global drop in foreign aid. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/09/13/550493934/what-s-at-stake-with-the-proposed-trump-foreign-aid-cuts

item.title: Montanans Pitch In To Bring Clean Air To Smoky Classrooms
item.description: September 13, 2017 - Montana has recently pushed all their young students indoors because of the unprecedented level of smoke from wildfires. Some community groups are now collaborating to clean up that indoor air.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 13, 2017 - Montana has recently pushed all their young students indoors because of the unprecedented level of smoke from wildfires. Some community groups are now collaborating to clean up that indoor air. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/13/550656850/montanans-pitch-in-to-bring-clean-air-to-smoky-classrooms

item.title: FDA Moves To Rein In Drugmakers' Abuse Of Orphan Drug Law
item.description: September 13, 2017 - Following an investigation by Kaiser Health News and NPR, the Food and Drug Administration has moved to close a loophole that let drugmakers skip pediatric testing of drugs to treat rare diseases.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 13, 2017 - Following an investigation by Kaiser Health News and NPR, the Food and Drug Administration has moved to close a loophole that let drugmakers skip pediatric testing of drugs to treat rare diseases. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/13/550700062/fda-moves-to-rein-in-drugmakers-abuse-of-orphan-drug-law

item.title: Mexican Women Look For Alternatives To Cesarean Sections
item.description: September 13, 2017 - Mexico has one of the highest cesarean section rates in the world. But as well-trained midwives become more available, natural birth is coming into vogue.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 13, 2017 - Mexico has one of the highest cesarean section rates in the world. But as well-trained midwives become more available, natural birth is coming into vogue. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/13/550607419/mexican-women-look-for-alternatives-to-cesarean-sections

item.title: Advocates Highlight Foreign Aid's Success Stories Amid Talk Of Cuts
item.description: September 13, 2017 - Earlier this year President Trump called for deep cuts in foreign aid. But even small cuts could be catastrophic for some aspects of global health.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 13, 2017 - Earlier this year President Trump called for deep cuts in foreign aid. But even small cuts could be catastrophic for some aspects of global health. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/13/550607329/advocates-highlight-foreign-aids-success-stories-amid-talk-of-cuts

item.title: U.S. Census Bureau Records Improvements In Income, Poverty And Health Coverage
item.description: September 12, 2017 - The U.S. Census Bureau released a trio of reports Tuesday on income, poverty and health insurance coverage. All three measures showed improvement. Real median household income increased by 3.2 percent in 2016 over the previous year, and now stands at just over $59,000. The official poverty rate fell for the second year in a row to 12.7 percent.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

The official poverty rate fell for the second year in a row to 12.7 percent. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/12/550492811/u-s-census-bureau-records-improvements-in-income-poverty-and-health-coverage

item.title: Pet Store Puppies Linked To Campylobacter Outbreak In People
item.description: September 12, 2017 - Adorable fuzzy puppies aren't usually thought of as disease vectors. But they come with germs, too. It's not clear how pet store puppies caused dozens of humans to get sick with Campylobacter.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - Adorable fuzzy puppies aren't usually thought of as disease vectors. But they come with germs, too. It's not clear how pet store puppies caused dozens of humans to get sick with Campylobacter. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/12/550423656/pet-store-puppies-linked-to-campylobacter-outbreak-in-people

item.title: The U.S. Thought It Was Rid Of Hookworm. Wrong
item.description: September 12, 2017 - The American medical establishment was confident: no hookworm disease in the country for decades. A new study uncovered cases in Alabama.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - The American medical establishment was confident: no hookworm disease in the country for decades. A new study uncovered cases in Alabama. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/09/12/550387650/the-u-s-thought-it-was-rid-of-hookworm-wrong

item.title: For Many Women, Cervical Cancer Screening May Get A Lot Simpler
item.description: September 12, 2017 - For decades the Pap test was the only option for cervical cancer screening. Now there's the HPV test, too. A federal task force says that for most women, either test will do just fine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - For decades the Pap test was the only option for cervical cancer screening. Now there's the HPV test, too. A federal task force says that for most women, either test will do just fine. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/12/550228352/for-many-women-cervical-cancer-screening-may-get-a-lot-simpler

item.title: Tom Frieden's New Venture Combines 2 Disparate Health Threats
item.description: September 12, 2017 - The former head of the Centers for Disease Control has $225 million for his global health group Resolve, which will aim to prevent stroke and cardiovascular disease as well as epidemics.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - The former head of the Centers for Disease Control has $225 million for his global health group Resolve, which will aim to prevent stroke and cardiovascular disease as well as epidemics. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/09/12/550386874/tom-frieden-s-new-venture

item.title: Is One Drink OK For Pregnant Women? Around The Globe, The Answer Is No
item.description: September 12, 2017 - Researchers set out to answer this question: Is there a safe level of alcohol consumption during pregnancy? Turns out, that's a hard question to answer. The advice remains: Don't risk it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - Researchers set out to answer this question: Is there a safe level of alcohol consumption during pregnancy? Turns out, that's a hard question to answer. The advice remains: Don't risk it. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/12/550152771/is-one-drink-ok-for-pregnant-women-around-the-globe-the-answer-is-no

item.title: What To Do When Your Health Insurance Won't Pay The Bills
item.description: September 12, 2017 - Insurers can reduce benefits or change how much they are willing to pay for services, but they are generally supposed to give customers 60 days' notice.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - Insurers can reduce benefits or change how much they are willing to pay for services, but they are generally supposed to give customers 60 days' notice. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/12/550245002/what-to-do-when-your-health-insurance-won-t-pay-the-bills

item.title: Red Cross Worker Slain In Afghanistan: 'All She Wanted To Do Was Help'
item.description: September 11, 2017 - Lorena Perez was a physiotherapist. On Monday, a patient in a wheelchair shot and killed her. The motive is not yet known.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - Lorena Perez was a physiotherapist. On Monday, a patient in a wheelchair shot and killed her. The motive is not yet known. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/09/11/550194713/red-cross-worker-slain-in-afghanistan-all-she-wanted-to-do-was-help

item.title: In Houston, Children Are Likely To Experience Trauma From Hurricane Harvey
item.description: September 11, 2017 - Students are returning to school in Houston, just a few weeks after Hurricane Harvey flooded the city. NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Joy Osofsky, a professor of pediatrics and psychiatry at Louisiana State University, about the trauma that children experience after natural disasters.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - Students are returning to school in Houston, just a few weeks after Hurricane Harvey flooded the city. NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Joy Osofsky, a professor of pediatrics and psychiatry at Louisiana State University, about the trauma that children experience after natural disasters. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/11/550218492/in-houston-children-are-likely-to-experience-trauma-from-hurricane-harvey

item.title: Sept. 11 First Responder Fights On Behalf Of Others Who Rushed To Help
item.description: September 11, 2017 - Demolition supervisor John Feal was working at ground zero 16 years ago when an 8,000-pound piece of steel crushed his foot. After being denied medical compensation, he became an advocate for others.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - Demolition supervisor John Feal was working at ground zero 16 years ago when an 8,000-pound piece of steel crushed his foot.
